column5: For Christmas, I got my dad and I a guided Muskie trip with Mike Hulbert (www.mikehulbert.com).  Mike fishes here in Northern Indiana in the Spring & Fall on Webster & Tippy Lakes, and the Barbie Chain and last year he put over 260 fish in the boat with the average size just under 40".  Well tomorrow is the day, and will be the first time either of us has fished for muskie.  It's been over 15 years since my dad & I were in a boat together, and he really doesn't fish much.  I'm really hoping he ties into a hog, but regardless I'm looking forward to the day.  His health is on the decline (a genetic family disease), and he's probably not going to be here in 5 years, so it's all about the memories...nothing more!  I'm hoping this turns into a yearly event......  It'll be Tuesday before I can post a report, as I'm taking Monday off to work on the house we just bought, but here's hoping I'll have something great to report (I know I will regardless).  Good luck to all you fishing the trout open'er...but C'MON MUSKIE!  dk
Fantastic Dustin! Good for you and your dad.  I hope both you and your dad are successful with the toothy critters  Looking foward to your report!  Congrats on the new house too!  Whopper

Wow!! Sounds like a great time for sure!  Memories is what it's really all about, and it's great to see you and your dad hitting the water together.  Looking forward to your post next week....good luck and good health!
Sounds like your in for an incredible day Dustin, and be sure to let us know how it turns out.  Hopefully your dad ties into the biggest slimer in the lake
Good luck Dustin.  I remember you mentioning this before about this trip.  Enjoy your Day out with your dad.
Guaranteed great time!  Can't wait to see your report.
Looking forward to the report. All the best of luck.
Good luck, let us know how you do, lot's of pics.

man musky in april that would be nice heck maybe we should make a OFC swill and go do some. Have a blast I know your memories will be the best for you. My father and I are heading out in 2 weeks for a weekend he had mentioned it a couple years ago after beating cancer that he wanted to go camping again so we have done it each year since I was so happy he made the choice as I had been bugging him for years to do it again and we will always remember each trip. make the best of it and turn the TV off listin to a ball game or just talk about the day. enjoy it

man musky in april that would be nice heck maybe we should make a OFC swill and go do some. Have a blast I know your memories will be the best for you. My father and I are heading out in 2 weeks for a weekend he had mentioned it a couple years ago after beating cancer that he wanted to go camping again so we have done it each year since I was so happy he made the choice as I had been bugging him for years to do it again and we will always remember each trip. make the best of it and turn the TV off listin to a ball game or just talk about the day. enjoy it

Thanks, guys!  I'm outta here until Tuesday.  Not sure how I'm going to sleep tonight....we're leaving at 4:30 for a 6:30 AM meet with Mike.  I talked to him today, and fishing on Webster was good yesterday, and he was going to Barbie Chain today, and we're going wherever he had more success.....  No way I'm sleeping.....report / pics on Tuesday!  dk

Mike is a fantastic Musky fisherman, he really knows his stuff. You will definately have a great time, and prolly learn more in 1 day that most would in a lifetime! See if you can get him to do the Weagle dance for you
Good luck for you and your father . By any standards it looks " priceless" .   :clapping:

Enjoy your time D-K......enjoy your time with the Big 'D' Its a memory of memories to come...............even if just once! You probably got all the bases covered.....I'd like to add just one.......... Make sure your camers batteries are charged and you have extra.........for your sake, not ours here on the board. Enjoy, enjoy and great fishing luck to the both of you,..this is exellence in the making.
Mike is a gerat guide, you will have a great time!  can you get a parrot colored mag dawg from him for me please!!! haha

Musky fishing already eh?  Guess I need to head to the states for a fix!  Good luck to you both.  Best thing about fishing is you usually come away with great memories regardless of how much (or little) you caught.

The time on the water together Justin will far out-weigh any fish you may catch.  Make the most of it and hopefully your dad will have a great day and want to do it more often.  I wish you both the best of luck and, when you come back, share your experience.  Go get 'em guys !
